sen.j: 平 時望（たいら の ときもち、元慶元年（877年） - 承平 (日本)8年3月24日 (旧暦)（938年4月26日）?）は、平安時代前期の貴族。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tokimochi (877-April 26, 938?) was a court noble in the first half of the Heian period.
TAIRA no Tokimochi (877-April 26, 938?) was a court noble in the first half of the Heian period.
TAIRA no Tokimochi (877-May 1, 938?) was a court noble in the first half of the Heian period.

sen.j: 平高棟（高棟王）の子である平惟範の長男で、桓武天皇の玄孫にあたる。
sen.e: He was the eldest child of TAIRA no Korenori who was the child of TAIRA no Takamune (Prince Takamune), which means he was the great-great-grandson of Emperor Kanmu.
He was the eldest child of TAIRA no Korenori, who was the child of TAIRA no Takamune (Prince Takamune), which means he was the great-great-grandson of Emperor Kanmu.
He was the eldest child of TAIRA no Korenori, who was the child of TAIRA no Takamune (Prince Takamune), which means he was the great-great-grandson of Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 母は、常陸国太守四品兼守弾正尹人康親王の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of the governor of Hitachi Province, Shihon (the fourth-ranked Imperial Prince), Kenshu Danjonokami, Imperial Prince Saneyasu.
His mother was a daughter of the governor of Hitachi Province, Shihon (the fourth-ranked Imperial Prince), Kenshu Danjonokami, Imperial Prince Saneyasu.
His mother was a daughter of the governor of Hitachi Province, Shihon (the fourth-ranked Imperial Prince), Kenshu Danjonokami, Imperial Prince Saneyasu.

sen.j: 子に平珍材、平真材がいる。
sen.e: Chinki Taira and TAIRA no Masaki were his children.
Chinki Taira and TAIRA no Masaki were his children.
Chinki Taira and TAIRA no Masaki were his children.

sen.j: 没日は3月25日、3月26日とも。
sen.e: The date of his death is said to be either on March 25, or March 26.
The date of his death is said to be either on March 25, or March 26.
The date of his death is said to be either on May 2, or May 3.

sen.j: ※日付は旧暦。
sen.e: *Date was indicated in old calendar.
*Dates are in the old calendar.
sen.cmt: plural dates; verb tense; article usage
sen.e: *Dates are in the old calendar.

sen.j: 寛平7年（895年）2月17日、周防国に任官。
sen.e: On February 17, 895, he was appointed to the post in Suo Province.
On February 17, 895, he was appointed to a post in Suo Province.
On February 17, 895, he was appointed to a post in Suo Province.

sen.j: 寛平9年（897年）7月13日、従五位下に叙位。
sen.e: On July 13, 897, he was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
On July 13, 897, he was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
On July 13, 897, he was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 周防権介如元。
sen.e: He remained in the position of Suo no Gonnosuke (supernumerary vice governor of Suo Province).
He remained in the position of Suo no Gonnosuke (supernumerary vice governor of Suo Province).
Retained his position as Suo no Gonnosuke (supernumerary vice governor of Suo Province).

sen.j: 昌泰3年（900年）8月20日、左京亮に転任。
sen.e: On August 20, 900, he was transferred to the position as sakyo no suke.
On August 20, 900, he was transferred to the position of sakyo no suke.
On August 20, 900, he was transferred to the position of sakyo no suke.

sen.j: 延喜4年（904年）2月26日、民部省に遷任。
sen.e: On February 26, 904, he was transferred to Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
On February 26, 904, he was transferred to Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
On February 26, 904, he was transferred to Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 延喜8年（908年）1月7日、従五位上に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 7, 908, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
On January 7, 908, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
On January 7, 908, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 民部少輔如元。
sen.e: He remained in the position as Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
He remained in the position of Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
Retained his position as Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 8月28日、大蔵省律令制における大蔵省に遷任。
sen.e: On August 28, he was transferred to Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) in Okurasho ritsuryo sei (the political system based on the codes of the Ministry of Finance).
On August 28, he was transferred to Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) in Okurasho ritsuryo sei (the political system based on the codes of the Ministry of Finance).
On August 28, he was transferred to Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) in Okurasho ritsuryo sei (the political system based on the codes of the Ministry of Finance).

sen.j: 延喜10年（910年）5月9日、衛門府に遷任。
sen.e: On May 9, 910, he was transferred to Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).
On May 9, 910, he was transferred to Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).
On May 9, 910, he was transferred to Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 延喜15年（915年）6月25日、大蔵省律令制における大蔵省（或いは、大蔵省律令制における大蔵省）に転任。
sen.e: On June 25, 915, he was transferred to Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) in Okurasho ritsuryo sei (the political system based on the codes of the Ministry of Finance) (or, Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) in Okurasho ritsuryo sei (the political system based on the codes of the Ministry of Finance)).
sen.cmt: 大蔵省（或いは、大蔵省律令制における大蔵省）→重複しているようですが原文どおり訳出しています。
sen.e: On June 25, 915, he was transferred to Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) under the Okurasho ritsuryo system (alternatively, Okura-sho under the in Okurasho ritsuryo system).
sen.cmt: removed nested parentheses by eliminating repetitive explanations of the Japanese words
sen.e: On June 25, 915, he was transferred to Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) under the Okurasho ritsuryo system (alternatively, Okura-sho under the in Okurasho ritsuryo system).

sen.j: 延喜16年（916年）3月28日、弁官に遷任。
sen.e: On March 28, 916, he was transferred to Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).
On March 28, 916, he was transferred to Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).
On March 28, 916, he was transferred to Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).

sen.j: 延喜17年（917年 1月7日、正五位下に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 7, 917, he was promoted to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 7, 917, he was promoted to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 7, 917, he was promoted to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 権右少弁如元。
sen.e: He remained in the position of Gon Ushoben (Provisional Minor Controller of the Right).
He remained in the position of Gon Ushoben (Provisional Minor Controller of the Right).
Retained his position as Gon Ushoben (Provisional Minor Controller of the Right).

sen.j: 延喜18年（918年）1月12日、弁官に転任。
sen.e: On January 12, 918, he was transferred to Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).
On January 12, 918, he was transferred to Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).
On January 12, 918, he was transferred to Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).

sen.j: 3月28日、造東大寺講堂長官に補す。
sen.e: On March 28, he was appointed to Zo-Todaiji-kodo-chokan (the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple lecture hall).
On March 28, he was appointed to Zo-Todaiji-kodo-chokan (the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple lecture hall).
On March 28, he was appointed to Zo-Todaiji-kodo-chokan (the Director for the Construction of Todai-ji Temple lecture hall).

sen.j: 延喜19年（919年）1月28日、弁官に遷任。
sen.e: On January 28, 919, he was transferred to the position of Benkan.
On January 28, 919, he was transferred to the position of Benkan.
On January 28, 919, he was transferred to the position of Benkan.

sen.j: 延喜21年（921年）1月7日、従四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 7, 921, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 7, 921, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 7, 921, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 左少弁如元。
sen.e: He remained in the position of Sashoben (third-ranked officer of the left).
He remained in the position of Sashoben (third-ranked officer of the left).
Retained his position as Sashoben (third-ranked officer of the left).

sen.j: 1月30日、修理職に転任。
sen.e: On January 30, he was transferred to Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).
On January 30, he was transferred to Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).
On January 30, he was transferred to Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).

sen.j: 延喜23年（923年）4月29日、春宮（慶頼王＝保明親王の皇子）亮を兼任。
sen.e: On April 29, 923, he assumed the additional post as Togu no suke (Assistant Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters (Prince Yasuyori; the son of Imperial Prince Yasuakira)).
On April 29, 923, he assumed the additional post of Togu no suke (Assistant Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters to Prince Yasuyori, the son of Imperial Prince Yasuakira).
On April 29, 923, he assumed the additional post of Togu no suke (Assistant Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters to Prince Yasuyori, the son of Imperial Prince Yasuakira).

sen.j: 6月27日、殿上人を聴される。
sen.e: On June 27, tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace).
sen.cmt: 聴される→文意が不明であったため訳出していません。
sen.e: On June 27, tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace).
On June 27, tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace).

sen.j: 延長 (日本)2年（924年）2月1日、信濃国を兼任。
sen.e: On February 1, 924, he took the additional post in Shinano Province.
On February 1, 924, he took an additional post in Shinano Province.
On February 1, 924, he took an additional post in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 延長3年（925年）1月30日、伊予国を兼任。
sen.e: On January 30, 925, he took the additional post in Iyo Province.
On January 30, 925, he took an additional post in Iyo Province.
On January 30, 925, he took an additional post in Iyo Province.

sen.j: 信濃権守の任替。
sen.e: Replacement in Shinano gonno-kami (Senior Provincial Governor of Shinano)
sen.cmt: 任替→定訳不明ですが→replacement と訳出しています。
sen.e: Transferred to Shinano gonno-kami (Senior Provincial Governor of Shinano).
Transferred to Shinano gonno-kami (Senior Provincial Governor of Shinano).

sen.j: 同年、春宮薨去に伴い、同官廃止。
sen.e: In the same year, the post as Togu no suke was abolished due to the death of Prince Yasuyori.
In the same year, the post of Togu no suke was abolished due to the death of Prince Yasuyori.
In the same year, the post of Togu no suke was abolished due to the death of Prince Yasuyori.

sen.j: 延長5年（927年）2月9日、蔵人頭に補任。
sen.e: On February 9, 927, he was appointed to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
On February 9, 927, he was appointed to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
On February 9, 927, he was appointed to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).

sen.j: 修理大夫・伊予守兼任如元。
sen.e: He remained in the positions as shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs) and as Iyo no Kami (Governor of Iyo Province).
He remained in the positions of shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs) and Iyo no Kami (Governor of Iyo Province).
Retained his position as shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs) and Iyo no Kami (Governor of Iyo Province).

sen.j: 延長6年（928年）1月7日、従四位上に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 7, 928, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
On January 7, 928, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 蔵人頭・修理大夫・伊予守如元。
sen.e: He remained in the positions as Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), Shuri no daibu, and as Iyo no Kami.
He remained in the positions of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), Shuri no daibu and Iyo no Kami.
Retained his position as Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), Shuri no daibu and Iyo no Kami.

sen.j: 6月9日、弁官に転任。
sen.e: On June 9, he was transferred to the position as Benkan.
On June 9, he was transferred to the position of Benkan.
On June 9, he was transferred to the position of Benkan.

sen.j: 蔵人頭・修理大夫如元。
sen.e: He remained in the positions as Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and as Shuri no daib.
He remained in the positions of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and Shuri no daib.
Retained his position as Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and Shuri no daibu.

sen.j: 延長8年（930年）1月29日、参議に補任。
sen.e: On January 29, 930, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor).
On January 29, 930, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor).
On January 29, 930, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor).

sen.j: 右大弁・修理大夫如元。
sen.e: He remained in the positions as Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right) and as Shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs).
He remained in the positions of Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right) and Shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs).

sen.j: 承平 (日本)元年（931年、讃岐国を兼任。
sen.e: In 931, he assumed the additional post in Sanuki Province.
In 931, he assumed an additional post in Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 承平3年（933年）10月24日、弁官を兼任。
sen.e: On October 24, 933, he assumed the additional post as Benkan.
On October 24, 933, he assumed the additional post of Benkan.

sen.j: 右大弁の任替。
sen.e: Replacement in Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right).
Transfer to Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right).

sen.j: 承平4年（934年）1月7日、正四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 7, 934, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 7, 934, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 7, 934, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 参議・左大弁・修理大夫如元。
sen.e: He remained in the positions as Sangi (councilor), Sadaiben (major controller of the left), and as Shuri no daibu.
He remained in the positions of Sangi (councilor), Sadaiben (major controller of the left) and Shuri no daibu.
He remained in the positions of Sangi (councilor), Sadaiben (major controller of the left) and Shuri no daibu.

sen.j: 承平7年（937年）3月8日、従三位に昇叙し、中納言に転任。
sen.e: On March 8, 937, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), and was transferred to Chunagon (middle counselor).
On March 8, 937, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), and was transferred to Chunagon (middle counselor).

sen.j: 承平8年（938年）3月24日または25日または26日薨去。
sen.e: He passed away either on March 24, 25, or 26.
He passed away either on March 24, 25 or 26.

sen.j: 享年62。
sen.e: He died at the age of sixty two.
He died at the age of 62.
